posts.author: Drake Strongfist
posts.content:
Ok people who are smarter than me! I've got one for you to work on. 

Barbarian for Arelith. 

Must have specs:

Min 16 lvls of Barb (to take full advantage of Arelith specific barb buffs) 

Two handed weapon (Personally I think the great axe is more "barby" but thats not a must have. I can be convinced otherwise)
  
Terror, and Thundering Rage

As much con as possible 

Dwarf or Half Orc will most likely be taken to help with str/con needs


Wishlist

Skill points! He's gonna need lots of intimidate and perhaps even taunt, I mean....why not taunt amirite? ;)

UMD.....lets face it.....on a low lvl magic server, its damn near a requirement for any build

DR feats would be nice if they could be squeezed in?

Maybe Weapon Specialization?

Thats it.... or at least all I can think of at the moment. I was thinking maybe start with 3 levels of rouge right out of the gate, then perhaps 16 barb levels, one more rogue, followed by 4 ftr lvls to squeeze in epic weapon spec at lvl 24, then finish off the last levels with all rogue for more tumble and such. But you're the experts here.

It's not much, just something to get you started, but here is a Barbarian for Arelith that get's 11 out of 12 Rages (if i read that correctly in Arelith's Wiki), loads of HP's, Epic Weapon Specialization, UMD, Lot's of Skills and some good combat feats to keep you alive. I am mainly concerned about his low-ish AB but i saw the the custom bonusses for Rage and those are mighty indeed. This is an easy-of-use stat array but if you want to extract every ounce of power out of that you can opt for more hardcore stat allocation and get to higher STR/CON. I stayed away from the wall-known Barb/Bard/RDD combo because i know that in Arelith you need special permission to do that. Anyway, see this raging dwarf and we talk again later.

Just a couple of things, if I might intrude on someone else's thread, for which apologies.

First, I know I'm nearly three years in now, but I stiil find the build turnaround time for some of you great and good gobsmacking.

Second, I take it Thundering Rage isn't the same lame beast in Arelith that it is in vanilla rules - so what does it give you?

Cheers

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Thundering Rage gives him nothing except one thing, it helps him rise his "Rage level" on Arelith.
To give you an example, right now he is at "Rage level 11" with 12 being the maximum.
Rage level 11 gives his Barbarian the following:
+2D10 melee damage bonus, a 36 HP's damage shield (like wounding whispers on Bard) every time they hit him, +16 to his Will save! amongst other bonusses...

The Page of reference is this one: http://wiki.arelith.com/Barbarian

Hope that helps

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Gotcha. Read the link, and it seems to me a sensible alternative "raging" system. Thanks, Valerfor

posts.author: Drake Strongfist
posts.content: Testing inside the module has revealed some interesting things. Half orcs get a free ambidexterity feat. Its supposed to be a nod to the orc double axe being a favored "racial" weapon. Also! Fun fact! The orc double axe is recognized by the game engine as a two handed weapon, this means that you get the bonus str damage as well as the free +3 "rage" levels (arelith custom content)
